here is the developer note here is the what\'s new content here is the supported languages text When a command is not recognised
Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer Saiy Remotely control Saiy features control certain features of Saiy. These features include the recording of audio, passing of this speech data to the remote application and varying the type of voice engine used. Your application is missing permission.CONTROL_SAIY Saiy Recognition Read and announce notification content. Interact with user input parameters. Please enable the Say accessibility service to use this feature. error Enabled Disabled success failed Share via Email via feedback model manufacturer Android locale save close engine Ask you to repeat State command unknown Send to Application Disclaimer Developer Note "What's New?" License & Legal Release Notes Source Code Developer APIs Development Testing Run Daniel Schlapa Hannes Ahremark blog.schlapa.net (dtrieb@xda) Commercial Enquiries Commercial Enquiry Special Thanks App Icon studioahremark.com Custom Intro Privacy Policy Volume Settings Enter a command to run… Recognizer Busy Fix Okay Google Fix
"an unknown application"
"asdasdasdasdashalsfhakhfssadasdaasdsagdsafgfghffhdsasdddfdghhgfhsdfdsad"
Done button
Permission Request Permission Request Permission Request - click for information Without this permission I cannot function. You can grant this by clicking the Permissions button below I require the, microphone, permission to record your voice and understand what you are saying. Without this permission, I\'m afraid I\'ll be useless\! You can grant this by clicking the Permissions button below I require the, accounts and contacts, permission to do many things. To associate your voice with a specific account. To assist you with making and receiving calls. To help you send text messages and announce their content. Sending emails, your social media obligations, and much more. I require the, accounts and contacts, permission to use this feature. You can manually allow this in the Application Settings, under permissions.
"Saiy has become self-aware" "AI level %1$s" "Listening" "Dictating" "Fetching" "Initialising TTS" "Computing" "tap to cancel" "tap to stop" "Stop hotword detection"
"No application is installed to handle this request?"
"I didn't receive any voice data from the recognition provider." "I didn't receive any voice data. This could be due to the profanity filter set by your voice recognition provider." "I don't know what I'm supposed to be doing." "No network connection!" "Hotword engine failed to initialise :(" "There was an audio recording error"
"There is a problem with your Text to Speech engine." "There was a problem with the Text to Speech playback." "Unable to set TTS language." "The media volume is muted."
"In order for the application to function, you need to have a voice recognition provider installed. Please install the Google Now application from the Play Store." "In order for the application to speak, you need to install a Text to Speech engine. Please select one from the list below and then set it as your default in the Android Text to Speech Settings, which can be found under the Language and Input section" "I was unable to speak in the requested language. This could be a simple solution, such as an additional download of the language files, which you can do from the settings within your voice engine. Click on the link below to go there." "Unfortunately, Samsung do not allow their Vlingo voice recognition to be used by any other applications, than S Voice. Please change the default provider to Google. Click the button below to go to the Settings." "Unfortunately, your device is suffering from a known Android bug, where I am unable to open the Usage Statistics Settings in order for you to grant me permission to access them. This will cause a number of problems with commands associated with application usage. Please check for an update to your Android version in your device settings, as your manufacturer may have already pushed a fix to resolve this."
"Offline recognition fails" This feature is only available if you are using Google Voice Recognition.\n\nYou\'ll need to make sure you have correctly downloaded and installed the offline recognition files from the Android Voice Search Settings.\n\nIt is often necessary to reboot your device once you have done this.\n\nClick to go to the Settings.
"I don't hear any speech?" First thing to check is your media volume. On some devices it may not be obvious that this stream alone is set too low or muted.\n\nA more likely problem is your voice engine is in error; this happens all too often… In the Android Text to Speech Settings double check any additional download files are installed and up to date. There\'s an option to \'listen to a sample\' which you can test too.\n\nIt\'s highly recommended to use the Google text to speech engine as at the time of writing, despite taking a little longer to initially warm up, it is the only one that seems to work at least relatively reliably…\n\nIf all else fails, try rebooting your device, as this can sometimes fix weird and wonderful problems for no apparent reason at all…\n\nTap for Text to Speech Settings. Tap and hold for Volume Settings
"There's a delay before speech" Text to speech engines take up a lot of resource and consequently can take a while to initialise and be ready to speak. This is more common on higher quality engines, regardless of whether they are downloaded and installed on the device or not.\n\nIn the Superuser Settings, under Memory Usage, you can adjust how long the text to speech engine is bound to Saiy and kept in the memory. The longer allowed time, the less likely the initialisation process will be required for subsequent commands\n\nThis additional memory usage should be negligible to the performance of any modern device. If Android needs the memory back, it will take it!\n\nIn the Saiy Settings, if you have selected to use the network synthesised voices (available via Google\'s text to speech engine), a delay can occur due to the speed of your network connection. If your mobile connectivity is a little hit and miss, disabling this feature unless you are connected to WiFi, could certainly help…\n\nTap for settings. Tap and hold for Superuser Settings
So I can automatically toggle the hotword recognition when you open certain applications, that may stream media content, or need access to the microphone, I require the statistics permission here. I\'ll then be able to check which apps you are using, and act accordingly.

"Sorry %1$s, but Wolfram Alpha didn't understand that"

"OK %1$s. Don't forget you need to speak for at least thirteen seconds."
"OK %1$s. In order for me to analyse your emotional state, you need to speak for at least thirteen seconds. After that, I'll detect when you've finished speaking. You could tell me about your day today, or about a memory from your past. If you can't think of anything, just close your eyes and count slowly up to fifteen, whilst your mind wanders. I'll let you know with a notification when the analysis is complete."
"Thank you %1$s. I'll notify you shortly when I've completed the emotion analysis."
